item.title: Warnie B. add a quote by Robert Falcon Scott
item.description: "Had we lived, I should have had a tale to tell of the hardihood, endurance and courage of my companions which would have stirred the heart of every Englishman. These rough notes and our dead bodies must tell the tale." -- Robert Falcon Scott

item.title: Warnie B. add a quote by L. M. Montgomery
item.description: "It is ever so much easier to be good if your clothes are fashionable." -- L. M. Montgomery

item.title: Warnie B. add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "The only way to cope with something deadly serious is to try to treat it a little lightly." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Warnie B. add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "You can never be overdressed or overeducated." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Warnie B. add a quote by Lewis Thomas
item.description: "If we had better hearing, and could discern the descants of sea birds, the rhythmic tympani of schools of mollusks, or even the distant harmonics of midges hanging over meadows in the sun, the combined sound might lift us off our feet." -- Lewis Thomas

item.title: Warnie B. add a quote by Richard Feynmann
item.description: "Study hard what interests you the most in the most undisciplined, irreverent and original manner possible." -- Richard Feynmann

item.title: Warnie B. add a quote by Maurice Herzog
item.description:
"Annapurna, to which we had gone emptyhanded, was a treasure on which we should live the rest of our days. With this realization we turn the page: a new life begins.
There are other Annapurnas in the lives of men." -- Maurice Herzog

item.title: Warnie B. add a quote by Jeannie Gunn
item.description: "When the heart is happy it forgets to grow old." -- Jeannie Gunn

item.title: Warnie B. add a quote by Richard Feynmann
item.description: "We are lucky to live in an age in which we are still making discoveries. " -- Richard Feynmann

item.title: Warnie B. add a quote by Lewis Thomas
item.description: "The greatest of all the accomplishments of 20th century science has been the discovery of human ignorance" -- Lewis Thomas

item.title: Warnie B. add a quote by Oscar Wilde
Warnie B. add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "You have to write the book that wants to be written. And if the book will be too difficult for grown-ups, then you write it for children." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Warnie B. add a quote by Roald Amundsen
item.description: "Adventure is just bad planning." -- Roald Amundsen

item.title: Warnie B. add a quote by Ernest Shackleton
item.description: "Difficulties are just things to overcome, after all." -- Ernest Shackleton

item.title: Warnie B. add a quote by Paul Murray
item.description: "History, in the end, is only another kind of story, and stories are different from the truth. The truth is messy and chaotic and all over the place. Often it just doesn’t make sense. Stories make things make sense, but the way they do that is to leave out anything that doesn’t fit. And often that is quite a lot." -- Paul Murray

item.title: Warnie B. add a quote by Herman Melville
item.description: "...and Heaven have mercy on us all - Presbyterians and Pagans alike - for we are all somehow dreadfully cracked about the head, and sadly need mending." -- Herman Melville

item.title: Warnie B. add a quote by Robertson Davies
item.description:
"Who's Mrs. Gummidge?'
'If you're a good girl and get well soon I'll lend you the book.'
'Oh, somebody in a book! All you people like Nilla and the Cornishes and that man Darcourt seem to live out of books. As if everything was in books!'
'Well, Schnak, just about everything is in books. No, that's wrong. We recognize in books what we've met in life. But if you'd read a few books you wouldn't have to meet everything as if it had never happened before, and take every blow right on the chin. You'd see a few things coming..." -- Robertson Davies

item.title: Warnie B. add a quote by Robertson Davies
item.description: "I wish people weren't so set on being themselves, when that means being a bastard." -- Robertson Davies
